name: IB ACIO (Intelligence Bureau Exam)
description: A national-level recruitment examination conducted by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) for the post of Assistant Central Intelligence Officer (ACIO) Grade-II/Executive in the Intelligence Bureau.
conductingBody: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), Government of India

eligibility.ageLimit: 18 to 27 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories as per government norms.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Graduation (Bachelor's Degree) from a recognized university. Desirable: Knowledge of computers.

timeline.resultDate: Tier-I result was declared in February 2024.

examPattern.mode: Tier-I: Online (CBT), Tier-II: Offline (Descriptive), Tier-III: In-person Interview

stages.name: Tier-I: Written Examination (Objective)
stages.description: An online test of 100 marks lasting 1 hour. It has 100 objective type MCQs, divided into 5 parts containing 20 questions of 1 mark each on: Current Affairs, General Studies, Numerical Aptitude, Reasoning/Logical Aptitude, and English.

stages.name: Tier-II: Written Examination (Descriptive)
stages.description: An offline test of 50 marks lasting 1 hour. It includes an Essay (30 marks) and English comprehension & pr√©cis writing (20 marks).

stages.name: Tier-III: Interview
stages.description: Candidates who clear Tier-II are called for a personality test and interview, which is for 100 marks. A psychometric/aptitude test may be a part of the interview.

stages.name: Stage 4: Document Verification & Medical Examination
stages.description: Final selection is subject to successful completion of character and antecedent verification followed by a medical examination.

examPattern.markingScheme: For Tier-I, there is a negative marking of 1/4 mark for each wrong answer. Tier-II is descriptive and marked subjectively.

syllabus.name: Tier-II: Descriptive
topics: Essay writing on contemporary national/international topics
